Articles.Content: Well, i just managed to land on Minmus... Kind of a unique view 8)
Nice, quite a big lander, especially as it takes almost no fuel to get off Minmus =P

I have a 20% success rate with missions to minimus. I also have a 0% success rate for return missions from minimus

Nice rocket though, hope you don\'t fuck up the return

Nice, keep improving your rocket design and you\'ll be able to land even more there. Im constantly launching missions to minmus, almost always works, and soemtimes I even get part of my second stage there 8) I usually have about 7 full fuel tanks then, saving the rockets for launching off to new planets then use the rovers on them there ;D

That looks nice. Took a break, and now I need to upgrade the game and give this a shot. I think I have a rocket prepared that can do it (it has enough range to orbit the sun at about half Kerbins orbit and return to the planet if you don\'t mess up, and have a lot of free time). Assuming I still have the craft file for it. Getting back should be interesting.

Love the view though, and that\'s one heck of an orbital inclination.

Nice picture! I like how it shows Kerbin looking tiny instead of how you can hardly see Minmus from an orbit around Kerbin.

I can hardly ever get my rockets into an orbit around Minmus; I can never time it right just by looking at the map view.
Great shot, and it looks like the Mun is visible above and to the right of your lander.
I\'m going with Coldfire here. Lose the second tank.
